entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character, referred to by name. (e.g. 'Harry, you look dead on your feet.')

entities.name: miss marjorie dursley
entities.description: Aunt of Harry's, who was involved in an incident that required the Accidental Magic Reversal Squad to intervene. (e.g. 'the unfortunate blowing-up of Miss Marjorie Dursley')

entities.name: fudge
entities.description: A person, possibly a Ministry official, who is speaking to Harry. (e.g. 'Fudge smiled at Harry over the rim of his teacup')

entities.name: accidental magic reversal squad
entities.description: A group that deals with magical accidents, mentioned as having been dispatched to Privet Drive. (e.g. 'Two members of the Accidental Magic Reversal Squad were dispatched to Privet Drive')

entities.name: privet drive
entities.description: The location where Miss Dursley lives, mentioned as being visited by the Accidental Magic Reversal Squad. (e.g. 'Two members of the Accidental Magic Reversal Squad were dispatched to Privet Drive')

entities.name: hogwarts
entities.description: A school that Harry attends, mentioned as a place where he will stay during holidays. (e.g. 'I always stay at Hogwarts for the Christmas and Easter holidays')

entities.name: christmas
entities.description: A holiday mentioned as one of the times when Harry stays at Hogwarts. (e.g. 'I always stay at Hogwarts for the Christmas and Easter holidays')

entities.name: easter
entities.description: A holiday mentioned as one of the times when Harry stays at Hogwarts. (e.g. 'I always stay at Hogwarts for the Christmas and Easter holidays')

relationships.description: Harry's aunt, Miss Dursley, was involved in an incident that required the Accidental Magic Reversal Squad to intervene. (e.g. 'the unfortunate blowing-up of Miss Marjorie Dursley')
The Accidental Magic Reversal Squad was dispatched to Privet Drive. (e.g. 'Two members of the Accidental Magic Reversal Squad were dispatched to Privet Drive')
Harry attends Hogwarts school. (e.g. 'I always stay at Hogwarts for the Christmas and Easter holidays')
